subnetIds.title: Subnet IDs
subnetIds.description: Subnet IDs to use for this node pool. This field is immutable and cannot be changed.

subnetTags.title: Subnet tags
subnetTags.description: Tags to filter which AWS subnets will be used for this node pool.

updateConfig.title: Update configuration of the nodegroup. Only one of maxUnavailable or maxUnavailablePercentage can be set. The maxUnavailable take precedence over maxUnavailablePercentage.

maxUnavailable.title: Max unavailable
maxUnavailable.description: MaxUnavailable is the maximum number of nodes unavailable at once during a version update. Nodes will be updated in parallel. The maximum number is 100.

maxUnavailablePercentage.title: Max unavailable percentage
maxUnavailablePercentage.description: MaxUnavailablePercentage is the maximum percentage of nodes unavailable during a version update. This percentage of nodes will be updated in parallel, up to 100 nodes at once.

cluster.title: Cluster
cluster.description: Helm values for the provider-independent cluster chart.

global.title: Global properties
global.description: Properties that are available to all charts and subcharts.

availabilityZoneUsageLimit.title: Availability zones
availabilityZoneUsageLimit.description: Maximum number of availability zones (AZ) that should be used in a region. If a region has more than this number of AZs then this number of AZs will be picked randomly when creating subnets.

internetGatewayId.title: Internet gateway ID
internetGatewayId.description: ID of the existing internet gateway to use. If not specified, a new internet gateway will be created.

items.title: Pod subnet
items.description: IPv4 address range for pods, in CIDR notation. Must be within the 100.64.0.0/10 or 198.19.0.0/16 range. The CIDR block size must be betwen /16 and /28.

items.title: Service subnet
items.description: IPv4 address range for kubernetes services, in CIDR notation.

vpcCidr.title: VPC subnet
vpcCidr.description: IPv4 address range to assign to this cluster's VPC, in CIDR notation.

vpcCidrs.title: Secondary VPC CIDR blocks
vpcCidrs.description: Additional CIDR blocks to be associated when the provider creates a managed VPC. Mutually exclusive with IPAMPool.

ipv4CidrBlock.title: IPv4 CIDR block
ipv4CidrBlock.description: IPv4 address range to associate with the VPC, in CIDR notation.

vpcId.title: VPC ID
vpcId.description: ID of an existing VPC to use. If not specified, a new VPC will be created.

podSubnets.title: Pod Subnets
podSubnets.description: Pod Subnets are created and tagged based on this definition.

cidr.title: Address range
cidr.description: IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this subnet.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this CIDR block.

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: Whether/how outgoing traffic is routed through proxy servers.

httpProxy.title: HTTP proxy
httpProxy.description: To be passed to the HTTP_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

httpsProxy.title: HTTPS proxy
httpsProxy.description: To be passed to the HTTPS_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

noProxy.title: No proxy
noProxy.description: To be passed to the NO_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

subnets.title: Subnets
subnets.description: Subnets are created and tagged based on this definition.

cidr.title: Address range
cidr.description: IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this subnet.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this CIDR block.

apiMode.title: API mode
apiMode.description: Whether the Kubernetes API server load balancer should be reachable from the internet (public) or internal only (private).

encryptionConfig.title: Encryption config
encryptionConfig.description: Encryption configuration for the Kubernetes API server.

keyArn.title: Key ARN
keyArn.description: AWS KMS key ARN. To enable encryption when creating a cluster, you need to create a new KMS key that has an alias name starting with `cluster-api-provider-aws-`. For example: `arn:aws:kms:eu-north-1:12345678901:alias/cluster-api-provider-aws-key1`. But do not use the ARN of the alias to fill this value, Use then ARN of the key itself.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Specifies the resources to be encrypted. The only supported value is secrets.

items.title: Resource
items.description: Specifies the resources to be encrypted. The only supported value is secrets.

apiServer.title: Api Server
apiServer.description: Enable or disable Api server logging to CloudWatch (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/control-plane-logs.html).

audit.title: Audit
audit.description: Enable or disable audit logging to CloudWatch (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/control-plane-logs.html).

authenticator.title: Authenticator
authenticator.description: Enable or disable IAM Authenticator logging to CloudWatch (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/control-plane-logs.html).

controllerManager.title: Controller Manager
controllerManager.description: Enable or disable Controller Manager logging to CloudWatch (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/control-plane-logs.html).

oidc.title: OIDC identity provider config
oidc.description: OIDC identity provider configuration for the Kubernetes API server.

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description: Client ID of the OIDC identity provider.

groupsClaim.title: Groups claim
groupsClaim.description: Claim to use for mapping groups.

groupsPrefix.title: Groups prefix
groupsPrefix.description: Prefix to use for mapping groups.

identityProviderConfigName.title: Identity provider config name
identityProviderConfigName.description: Name of the OIDC identity provider config.

issuerUrl.title: Issuer URL
issuerUrl.description: URL of the OIDC identity provider.

requiredClaims.title: Required claims
requiredClaims.description: Required claims for the OIDC identity provider.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to the IAM OIDC provider.

usernameClaim.title: Username claim
usernameClaim.description: Claim to use for mapping usernames.

usernamePrefix.title: Username prefix
usernamePrefix.description: Prefix to use for mapping usernames.

items.title: Role mapping
items.description: Maps AWS IAM role to Kubernetes role.

rolearn.title: AWS Role ARN
rolearn.description: Full ARN of the AWS IAM role.

managementCluster.title: Management cluster
managementCluster.description: Name of the Cluster API cluster managing this workload cluster.

description.title: Cluster description
description.description: User-friendly description of the cluster's purpose.

name.title: Cluster name
name.description: Unique identifier, cannot be changed after creation.

servicePriority.title: Service priority
servicePriority.description: The relative importance of this cluster.

nodePools.title: Node pools
nodePools.description: Node pools of the cluster. If not specified, this defaults to the value of `internal.nodePools`.

additionalResourceTags.title: Additional resource tags
additionalResourceTags.description: Additional tags to add to AWS resources created by the cluster.

addons.title: EKS Addons
addons.description: List of EKS addons to enable with the EKS cluster.

conflictResolution.title: Conflict resolution
conflictResolution.description: Declare what should happen if there are parameter conflicts. Defaults to none.

serviceAccountRoleARN.title: Service Account Role ARN
serviceAccountRoleARN.description: The ARN of an IAM role to bind to the addon's service account.

ami.title: Amazon machine image (AMI)
ami.description: If specified, this image will be used to provision EC2 instances.

awsAccountId.title: AWS account ID
awsAccountId.description: AWS Account ID of the AWSClusterRoleIdentity IAM role, recommendation is to leave this value empty as it will be automatically calculated. This value is needed for tests.

awsClusterRoleIdentityName.title: Cluster role identity name
awsClusterRoleIdentityName.description: Name of an AWSClusterRoleIdentity object. This in turn refers to the IAM role used to create all AWS cloud resources when creating the cluster. The role can be in another AWS account in order to create all resources in that account. Note: This name does not refer directly to an IAM role name/ARN.

kubeProxy.title: Kube Proxy
kubeProxy.description: KubeProxy defines managed attributes of the kube-proxy daemonset.

disable.title: Disable kube-proxy
disable.description: Disable set to true indicates that kube-proxy should be disabled. With EKS clusters, kube-proxy is automatically installed into the cluster. For clusters where you want to use kube-proxy functionality that is provided with an alternate CNI, this option provides a way to specify that the kube-proxy daemonset should be deleted. You cannot set this to true if you are using the Amazon kube-proxy addon.

vpcCni.title: VPC CNI
vpcCni.description: Configuration for the AWS VPC CNI.

disable.title: Disable
disable.description: Disable indicates that the Amazon VPC CNI should be disabled. With EKS clusters the Amazon VPC CNI is automatically installed into the cluster. For clusters where you want to use an alternate CNI this option provides a way to specify that the Amazon VPC CNI should be deleted. You cannot set this to true if you are using the Amazon VPC CNI addon.

internal.title: Internal
internal.description: For Giant Swarm internal use only, not stable, or not supported by UIs.

hashSalt.title: Hash salt
hashSalt.description: If specified, this token is used as a salt to the hash suffix of some resource names. Can be used to force-recreate some resources.

managementCluster.title: Management cluster
managementCluster.description: Name of the Cluster API cluster managing this workload cluster.
